mechanism: Both affect coagulation pathways; aspirin inhibits platelets while warfarin inhibits vitamin K-dependent clotting factors
recommendation: Avoid combination if possible. If necessary, use low-dose aspirin and monitor INR weekly. Watch for signs of bleeding.

effect: Increased risk of GI bleeding and elevated INR
mechanism: NSAIDs inhibit platelets and may displace warfarin from protein binding
recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs. Use paracetamol for pain. If NSAID essential, add PPI and monitor INR closely.

mechanism: ACE inhibitors reduce aldosterone, decreasing potassium excretion
recommendation: Monitor serum potassium regularly. Avoid potassium supplements unless truly deficient.

mechanism: Both drugs increase potassium retention
recommendation: Start spironolactone at low dose. Monitor potassium within 1 week and regularly thereafter.

mechanism: IV contrast can cause acute kidney injury, impairing metformin clearance
recommendation: Hold metformin 48 hours before and after IV contrast. Check creatinine before restarting.

effect: Increased risk of myopathy and rhabdomyolysis
mechanism: Both drugs can cause muscle toxicity; effect is additive
recommendation: Avoid gemfibrozil with statins. If fenofibrate needed, use lowest statin dose and monitor for muscle symptoms.

mechanism: Combined serotonergic effect leads to dangerous serotonin accumulation
recommendation: Never combine. Allow 2-week washout when switching between these drug classes.

mechanism: Both cause vasodilation through NO/cGMP pathway; effect is synergistic
recommendation: Absolutely contraindicated. Do not use within 24 hours of each other (48 hours for tadalafil).

mechanism: Amiodarone inhibits P-glycoprotein, reducing digoxin clearance by 50%
recommendation: Reduce digoxin dose by 50% when starting amiodarone. Monitor digoxin levels.

mechanism: Verapamil inhibits P-glycoprotein and both drugs slow heart rate
recommendation: Reduce digoxin dose by 25-50%. Monitor heart rate and digoxin levels.

mechanism: Both drugs slow AV conduction
recommendation: Avoid combination, especially IV. If oral combination needed, monitor closely.

mechanism: NSAIDs reduce renal lithium clearance
recommendation: Avoid NSAIDs or monitor lithium levels closely. Consider sulindac which may have less effect.

mechanism: ACE inhibitors reduce renal lithium clearance
recommendation: Monitor lithium levels when starting or adjusting ACE inhibitor dose.

mechanism: Ciprofloxacin inhibits CYP1A2, the main enzyme metabolizing theophylline
recommendation: Reduce theophylline dose by 30-50%. Monitor theophylline levels. Consider alternative antibiotic.

mechanism: Omeprazole inhibits CYP2C19, reducing conversion of clopidogrel to active metabolite
recommendation: Use pantoprazole or H2 blocker instead. If omeprazole essential, separate dosing by 12 hours.

mechanism: NSAIDs reduce renal clearance of methotrexate
recommendation: Avoid in high-dose methotrexate. In low-dose, use with caution and monitor CBC.

mechanism: Both drugs inhibit folate metabolism
recommendation: Avoid combination. Use alternative antibiotic. If essential, supplement with folinic acid.

mechanism: Complex interaction - initial increase then decrease in warfarin effect
recommendation: Monitor INR closely when starting, stopping, or adjusting phenytoin dose.

mechanism: Carbamazepine induces CYP3A4, increasing metabolism of estrogen/progesterone
recommendation: Use higher dose OCP or alternative contraception. Consider IUD or depot injections.

mechanism: Fluconazole inhibits CYP2C9, reducing warfarin metabolism
recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose empirically. Monitor INR within 3-5 days of starting fluconazole.

mechanism: Clarithromycin inhibits CYP3A4, increasing statin levels
recommendation: Hold statin during clarithromycin course, or use pravastatin/rosuvastatin which are less affected.

mechanism: Erythromycin inhibits CYP3A4, reducing theophylline clearance
recommendation: Reduce theophylline dose or use azithromycin which has less interaction potential.

effect: Increased statin levels and myopathy risk
mechanism: Amlodipine inhibits CYP3A4, reducing simvastatin metabolism
recommendation: Limit simvastatin to 20mg/day with amlodipine. Consider alternative statin.

mechanism: Spironolactone is potassium-sparing; additional potassium increases risk
recommendation: Avoid potassium supplements with spironolactone unless potassium is truly low.

effect: Increased seizure risk and serotonin syndrome
mechanism: Both drugs have serotonergic activity and tramadol lowers seizure threshold
recommendation: Use with caution. Consider alternative analgesic. Watch for serotonin syndrome symptoms.

mechanism: Divalent cations (Mg, Al, Ca) chelate fluoroquinolones
recommendation: Separate dosing by at least 2 hours. Give ciprofloxacin first.

mechanism: Calcium binds levothyroxine in GI tract
recommendation: Separate dosing by at least 4 hours. Take levothyroxine on empty stomach.

mechanism: Iron binds levothyroxine in GI tract
recommendation: Separate dosing by at least 4 hours.

mechanism: Metronidazole inhibits aldehyde dehydrogenase
recommendation: Avoid alcohol during treatment and for 3 days after completing course.

mechanism: Allopurinol inhibits xanthine oxidase, blocking azathioprine metabolism
recommendation: Reduce azathioprine dose by 75%. Monitor CBC closely. Consider alternative.

mechanism: Both drugs slow AV conduction
recommendation: Use with caution. Monitor heart rate. Avoid if heart block present.

mechanism: Amiodarone inhibits CYP2C9 and has very long half-life
recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 30-50%. Monitor INR weekly initially. Effect persists weeks after stopping.

mechanism: ARBs reduce aldosterone, causing potassium retention
recommendation: Monitor potassium regularly. Avoid supplements unless deficient.

mechanism: Some quinolones inhibit theophylline metabolism
recommendation: Monitor theophylline levels. Levofloxacin and moxifloxacin have less interaction.

mechanism: Rifampicin is a potent CYP inducer, increasing warfarin metabolism
recommendation: May need to double or triple warfarin dose. Monitor INR very closely.

mechanism: Rifampicin induces metabolism of hormones
recommendation: Use alternative contraception during and for 4 weeks after rifampicin.

mechanism: Ketoconazole is a potent CYP3A4 inhibitor, dramatically increasing statin levels
recommendation: Contraindicated. Hold statin during ketoconazole treatment.

effect: Increased statin levels and myopathy risk
mechanism: Grapefruit inhibits intestinal CYP3A4
recommendation: Avoid grapefruit juice with simvastatin. Consider pravastatin or rosuvastatin.

mechanism: Both have serotonergic effects; fluoxetine also inhibits tramadol metabolism
recommendation: Use alternative analgesic. If essential, start low and monitor closely.

mechanism: Ibuprofen blocks aspirin's access to platelet COX-1
recommendation: Take aspirin 30 minutes before ibuprofen, or use paracetamol instead.

mechanism: Fluconazole inhibits sulfonylurea metabolism
recommendation: Monitor blood glucose closely. May need to reduce sulfonylurea dose.

mechanism: Beta blockers block adrenergic symptoms of hypoglycemia
recommendation: Use cardioselective beta blockers. Educate patient about hypoglycemia signs.

mechanism: Gemfibrozil inhibits statin glucuronidation and increases muscle uptake
recommendation: Avoid gemfibrozil with any statin. Use fenofibrate if fibrate needed.

mechanism: Ceftriaxone-calcium precipitates can form in lungs and kidneys
recommendation: Contraindicated in neonates. In adults, do not mix in same IV line.

mechanism: Beta blockers block vasodilation, worsening rebound
recommendation: If stopping clonidine, taper slowly. Stop beta blocker first.

mechanism: Divalent cations chelate tetracyclines
recommendation: Separate dosing by 2-3 hours.

effect: Reduced phenytoin levels or folate deficiency
mechanism: Complex bidirectional interaction
recommendation: If supplementing folate, monitor phenytoin levels.

mechanism: Both damage gastric mucosa; additive effect
recommendation: Add PPI for gastroprotection. Monitor for GI symptoms.

mechanism: ARBs cause potassium retention
recommendation: Monitor potassium. Avoid supplements unless truly deficient.

mechanism: ACE inhibitors cause potassium retention
recommendation: Monitor potassium. Avoid supplements unless truly deficient.
